content: Fort Bragg is renamed to Fort Liberty.
The Senate passes a bill to raise the debt ceiling and avert a default, sending it to President Biden, who has indicated he will sign it into law.
Nvidia becomes the first chipmaker valued at over $1 trillion, amid the ongoing AI boom.
Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO and founder of blood-testing company Theranos, begins an 11-year prison sentence for defrauding investors.
In what is seen as a major breakthrough, House Republicans and the White House reach a deal to raise the debt ceiling and prevent the United States from defaulting.

In a 121-23 vote, the Texas House of Representatives votes to impeach Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton. A trial will be held by the Texas Senate to determine his removal. It is the first time in which a state official has been impeached since 1975 as well as the third time in the entire history of the state.
Florida Governor Ron DeSantis launches his campaign to run for President of the United States.
United States Attorney for the District of Massachusetts Rachael Rollins resigns after an ethics probe finds that she had grossly violated multiple policies and lied under oath.
2024 United States presidential election: South Carolina Senator Tim Scott files to run in the 2024 Republican Party presidential primaries.
